author: ElectricWarr
body:
Simple: I've just updated my powershell docker image, and `powershell` has been replaced with `pwsh`. I appreciate the shortcut, but it should have been an optional addition.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```
docker run -it microsoft/powershell powershell
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```shell
PowerShell v6.0.0-rc.2
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /> 
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```shell
docker: Error response from daemon: oci runtime error: container_linux.go:265: starting container process caused "exec: \"powershell\": executable file not found in $PATH".
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value                                                                                                                                 
----                           -----                                                                                                                                 
PSVersion                      6.0.0-rc.2                                                                                                                            
PSEdition                      Core

Platform                       Unix

PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
try `docker run -it microsoft/powershell pwsh`
the `powershell` binary was renamed to `pwsh` several beta versions ago.
  

edit: nevermind I see you are aware of that.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
@ElectricWarr trying to understand your ask.  Is your complaint that:

```bash
docker run -it microsoft/powershell
```

Starts pwsh automatically?  Or that you want:

```bash
docker run -it microsoft/powershell powershell
``

To start pwsh?  At this time, defaulting to `pwsh` is the expected behavior.  As you noted, `powershell` as the exe name doesn't exist.

title: Docker: `powershell` is no longer a valid command for the `microsoft/powershell:latest` image on Linux
